info:
Formation: Present tense of the auxiliary verb "haber" + past participle of the main verb.
Example: "He comido" (I have eaten).
Usage: Similar to English, it denotes actions that occurred at an unspecified time before now or have relevance to the present. It can also indicate a recent past action or an action that still has relevance.
native_answer: She has asked the teacher for extra help.
prompt: Ella ______ ayuda extra al profesor.
answer: Ella ha pedido ayuda extra al profesor.
audio_dir: Ella ha pedido ayuda extra al profesor.
